reviewText: Billy found love again and married Tony. They lived a life of love and happiness. Billy passed away after a short illness on Friday, July 21. RIP Billy.
This is a story that needs to be told. Hopefully everyone who sees it will have their hearts, AND their minds, cracked wide open. Beautiful and heartbreaking.

Honest and touching an important story to be told.  Thank you Billy for sharing your pain and your experience for the education of others. Marriage equality will soon be the national norm.  As it well should be.

Journalist Billy Manes' story is about the loss of his partner of 10 years who was the love of his life, and the sad ordeal he faced because of the partner's family, who did not acknowledge Billy before Alan's death and certainly not afterwards. The family took possession of the body and claimed all that had been willed to Billy by Alan. THis relatively short film should be seen by anyone who thinks same-sex marriage is not an important equal rights challenge that must be met.

As a Gay Single Male who has no desire to enter into a relationship, and who does not even believe in heterosexual marriage, this documentary opened my eyes. I have always supported Gay marriage since I believe all people should have the freedom to choose, but this film clearly explained why it is so vitally important.
